alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Early; Miller (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 12 at 5:10PM EDT until May 12 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Northeastern Houston County in southeastern Alabama... Northwestern Miller County in southwestern Georgia... Southern Clay County in southwestern Georgia... Southwestern Calhoun County in southwestern Georgia... Early County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 600 PM EDT/500 PM CDT/. * At 510 PM EDT/410 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Fort Gaines to near Columbia to near Ashford to Taylor, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Fort Gaines, Blakely, Ashford, Cowarts, Edison, Arlington, Columbia, Centerville, Avon, Gordon, Bellville, Bluffton, Memphis, Shorterville, Saffold, Pansey, Parksville, Hayes, Wilson Mill and Mayhaw. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
